p: Plant tolerance to high or low PAR condition is regulated by the microclimate modification. Increase in shade level reduces PAR and alters light intensity, affecting the photosynthetic rate, and crop yield production. Higher PAR was recorded at mid day under control (1500 μ mol -1m -2s -1) followed by 25% (800 μ mol -1m -2s -1) and 50% shade level (500 μ mol -1m -2s -1) ( Fig 2). The results were similar to the studies of clary sage ( Salvia sclarea), and behavior of rose cultivar in different shade levels in which decreased PAR under increased shaded conditions was reported [ 4, 5].
